title: Welcome to Contenta
body:
Contenta is an API-First distribution. If you are seeing this page, it means that you have installed the demo content for the distribution. After installing the demo content, you can start making requests right away.

JSON API server

Contenta ships with the JSON API module to expose your data model and to start interacting with it right away. To get started use your favorite HTTP client and issue the following request:

GET /jsonapi HTTP/1.1
Host: example.org
Accept: application/vnd.api+json

That will return you a list of resources you can explore. In particular, the /jsonapi/node/recipe resource will give you information about all the existing entities. Please read the documentation in Drupal.org and the video series in YouTube to find out more about how to interact with the JSON API server.

OAuth2 Authentication

Contenta enables OAuth2 authentication out of the box using the Simple OAuth module. It enables the password grant, but it also comes configured with the client credentials, authentication code and implicit grants.

Depending on the application you are building you will need one or another grant. You can use this diagram to decide which grant is the most appropriate for you.

Automatic data model documentation

One of the goals of Contenta is to allow front end developers to create amazing digital experiences. To help them Contenta ships with the Docson to expose automatically generated rich documentation of the API. To use it, navigate to the docson schema selector page:

https://example.org/docson
author: Kinnikuman

title: About us
body:
The Contenta team is a group of people passionate about Drupal that believe that the future of the web is in the multi-distribution channels.

This distribution is the result of many discussions on how to have a Drupal installation that is ready for ambitious decoupled projects in a single click.

Among others, main contributors are:

  • Daniel Wehner (dawehner).
  • Mateu Aguil√≥ Bosch (e0ipso).

You can find us and ask questions in the Contenta slack channel for the Drupal organization.
author: Contenta team
